parameterdescription.para: char> *Img is a pointer to the image of type CImg, and that is treated as a unsigned char.
int width refers to the width of the image.
int height refers to the height of the image.
int depth refers to the depth of the image.
int spectrum refers to the spectrum of the image.

briefdescription.para: Constructor This constructor initializes the four dimension params at 0; The Img calls the constructor of CImg to create an empty image.
Image() is the constructor of the image used when the image doesn't been be created.

detaileddescription.para:
This constructor is used when the image already exist's and is stored in the
filename
path.

parameterdescription.para: is a var of type Cimg that is treated like an unsigned char.
refers to the number of columns of pixels in the image.
refers to the number of rows of pixels in the image.
is the amount of layers of depth the image has, usually is one, except for 3D images.
is the number of channels in the image, RGB has a spectrum of 3, a monocromatic image has a spectrum of 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned int width, const unsigned int height, const unsigned int depth, const unsigned int spectrum, int value)
memberdef.name: Image

briefdescription.para: Image (const char *const filename) this constructor is used when the image already exist's and is stored in.

detaileddescription.para: This constructor is used when we need to create an image, and gives the dimensions of the image, and the value of a color that fills all the pixels.

Image (const unsigned int width, const unsigned int height, const unsigned int depth, const unsigned int spectrum, int value) This constructor is used when we try to create an image with the specified dimensions and the parameter
value
is the value of the color of all the pixels of the image.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int y, int z, int c, unsigned char)
memberdef.name: set_pixel_value

briefdescription.para: This function substracts the pixel values of two images, that can be used to see the differences between them.

parameterdescription.para: image2: Is the image that will be substracted to the original image.

simplesect.para: Image result: Is the result of the substraction of both images.

briefdescription.para: This function multiplies the pixel values by a factor. If the pixel value is higher than 255, adjust the pixel value to 255.

parameterdescription.para: multiplier is the factor that mutiplies all the pixel values.

simplesect.para: Image result: Is the result of multiply the image.

briefdescription.para: Returns an image after applying the Laplacian filter to the image. Considers the diagonal values This function applies a convolution with this kernel: $ ((1, 1, 1), (1, -8, 1), (1, 1, 1)) $.

simplesect.para: A Filtered image with the Laplacian filter applied.

detaileddescription.para:
Works as a derivative function, reacts to high change on the pixels value, especially to noise, and borders. Applies the following filter: $ ((0, -1, 0) , (-1, 4, -1) , (0, -1, 0)) $
A filtered Image with the laplacian filter.

This filter is used as as Sharpening Spatial Filter, used to identify borders and noise in the image. Can be used to identify vertical borders or discrepations. Applies the following filter: $ ((1, 0, -1) , (2, 0, -2) , (1, 0, -1)) $
An image object that contains the original image after receiving a gradient filter in the vertical direction. Could be used to identify vertical borders.

This filter is used as as Sharpening Spatial Filter, used to identify borders and noise in the image. Can be used to identify horizontal borders or discrepation Applies the following filter: $ ((1, 2, 1) , (0, 0, 0) , (-1, -2, -1)) $
An image object that contains the original image after receiving a gradient filter in the horizontal direction. Could be used to identify horizontal borders.

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the median of the range of pixels into the kernel and sets this value in the central pixel of the kernel.

parameterdescription.para: receives the dimension of the kernel (dim), wich only can be an impair number.

simplesect.para: Image filtered which is the image with the median filter applied.

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the average of the range of pixels into the kernel and sets this value in the central pixel of the kernel.

parameterdescription.para: receives the dimension of the kernel (dim), wich only can be an impair number.

simplesect.para: Image filtered which is the image with the average filter applied.

briefdescription.para: This function applies a gaussian kernel trough the hole image.

parameterdescription.para: the dimension of the kernel (dim_kernel) and a paremeter o wich stablish the values on the gaussian kernel.

simplesect.para: Image filtered which is the image with the gaussian filter applied.

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the modal of the range of pixels into the kernel and sets this value in the central pixel of the kernel.

parameterdescription.para: receives the dimension of the kernel (dim), wich only can be an impair number.

simplesect.para: Image filtered which is the image with the modal filter applied.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned char, unsigned char, double, double, double, int)
memberdef.name: filter_dynamic_range_dilatation

briefdescription.para: All the pixel values are divided in 3 ranges, and each range suffer a diferent transformation. This function is used to transform the range of lower pixel values in medium values and the higher too, to smooth the image.

parameterdescription.para: char a is the first cutoff pixel value.
char b is the second cutoff pixel value.
alpha is the first multiplier.
beta is the second multiplier.
gamma is the third multiplier.

simplesect.para: An image object that contains the dilatated image.

detaileddescription.para:
Executes this transformation: $ v(x,y,z,c) = 255 - u(x,y,z,c) $
An image object that contains the inverse of the original image, this means that every pixel value is substracted to 255.

Executes this transformation: $ v(x,y,z,c) = c log(u(x,y,z,c)+1)$ where v(x,y,z,c) is the transformed pixel, and u(x,y,z,c) is the original pixel.
An image object that contains the inverse of the original image, this means that every pixel value is substracted to 255.

briefdescription.para: Executes this transformation: $ v(x,y,z,c) = c log(u(x,y,z,c)+1)$.

detaileddescription.para:
Applies a transformation given by the ecuation $ v(x,y) = c {u(x,y)}^{\gamma} $ where $ u(x,y) $ is the value of the non filtered image, and $ v(xy) $ is the intensity value in the filtered image. $ \gamma, c $ are constants. In this case $ \gamma $ is a parameter.
A filtered image with the power law transformation

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned char[], unsigned char[], unsigned char[], int)
memberdef.name: color_slicing

briefdescription.para: Highlights the desired colors, between the two colors given as parameters.

simplesect.para: {The colors must be unsigned char, and must be the size of the spectrum of the image (Number of channels), 3 in case o RBG images}

parameterdescription.para: char color1[]: The start color of the color slicing.
char color2[]: The end color of the color slicing.
char neutral: The intensity every other pixels that are not between the given colors will be set to.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns an array containing the values of the histogram points, in the desired channel and depth. An Histogram is measure of the frecquency of a intensity value in an image, and is often used as a parameter to improve the constrast and quality of the image. After observing the histogram ( see plot_histogram() ) you could ecualizate the image.

briefdescription.para: This function plot the histogram, using the CImg histogram function.

parameterdescription.para: is the number of bars or columns that appear in the histogram.
is the title of the histogram.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the autocovariance matrix for the image. The covariance, calculates the covariance matrix of an image. This function calculates something similar to the function below: $ g(x,y) = \sum \limits_{n=0}^{N} \sum \limits_{m=1}^M \left( f(x,y) - \overline{f(x,y)}\right)\left(f(x + \Delta x, y + \Delta y) - \overline{f(x + \Delta x, y + \Delta y)} \right) $ Where it calculates the variation between two series, one is the normal one, and the other is displaced by two parameters $ x$ & $ y$. For an image it its calculated for a neighborhood around each pixel.

simplesect.para: A CImg object, because it must contain float values.

briefdescription.para: This function compute the variance of an image. The variance is gived by the summation of the average multiplied by the substraction of the average with the pixel value, squared.

simplesect.para: This function returns the image interpolated.

briefdescription.para: Applies the kirsch mask at 0. $(-3,-3,5)(-3,0,5)(-3,-3,5)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 45. $(-3,5,5)(-3,0,5)(-3,-3,-3)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 90. $(5,5,5)(-3,0-3)(-3,-3,-3)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 135. $(5,5,-3)(5,0,-3)(-3,-3,-3)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 180. $(5,-3,-3)(5,0,-3)(5,-3,-3)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 225. $(-3,-3,-3)(5,0,-3)(5,5,-3)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 270. $(-3,-3,-3)(-3,0,-3)(5,5,5)$.
Applies the kirsch mask at 315. $(-3,-3,-3)(-3,0,5)(-3,5,5)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(1,1,1)(1,-2,1)(1,-1,-1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(1,1,1)(-1,-2,1)(1,-1,1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $)-1,1,1)(-1,-2,1)(1,1,1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(-1,-1,1)(-1,-2,1)(1,1,1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(-1,-1,-1)(1,-2,1)(1,1,1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(1,-1,-1)(1,-2,-1)(1,1,1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(1,1,-1)(1,-2,-1)(1,1,-1)$.
Applies the freeman mask $(1,1,1)(1,-2,-1)(1,-1,-1)$.
Assigns the highest value in the neighborhood. Assigns the highest value in the neighborhood around the desired pixel.
Assigns the highest value in the neighborhood.
Assigns the lowest value in the neighborhood.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts an RGB image to one in gray scale. The library uses this conversion: f(x,y)= 0.11R+0.56G + 0.14B Where f is the intensity of the pixel on the gray scale and R,G and B the pixel values on the different channels.

simplesect.para: This function returns the mochromathic image.

briefdescription.para: Converts an RGB image to gray scale.

detaileddescription.para: This function applies the gaussian noise to an image. The gaussian noise increases or decreases intensity to a pixel, depending of the variance.

parameterdescription.para: this parameter is used to set the value of noise that is applied to the image.

briefdescription.para: Put pepper (black pixels) and salt(white pixels)

parameterdescription.para: is used to compute the percentage of salt and pepper that is applied to the image.

briefdescription.para: This function doubles the size of the image and use the closer neighborhood interpolation.

simplesect.para: This function returns the image interpolated.

briefdescription.para: This function compute the coorrelogram of an image.

detaileddescription.para: This function compute the coorrelogram of a specified depth and spectrum of an image.

parameterdescription.para: int ver is the vertical distance of the original pixel that we use to compute the coorrelogram.
int hor is the horizontal distance of the original pixel that we use to compute the coorrelogram.

simplesect.para: This function returns the coorrelogram image.

parameterdescription.para: int ver is the vertical distance of the original pixel that we use to compute the coorrelogram.
int hor is the horizontal distance of the original pixel that we use to compute the coorrelogram.
int z is the specified depth of the image that will be obtained the coorrelogram.
int c is the specified spectrum of the image that will be obtained the coorrelogram.

simplesect.para: This function returns the coorrelogram image.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, int)
memberdef.name: coorrelogram_ZC

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int, unsigned int)
memberdef.name: coorrelogram_par

briefdescription.para: The Image class is the abstraction of the image, contains a CImg object that defines the handling of the image.

detaileddescription.para: This class have the attributes of the four dimensions of the image: height, width, depth and spectrum
